channel.title: Things to be done before announcing the forum
channel.description:
_Moved to #uncategorized so that everyone can see it, as there's no staff yet :)_
Welcome to the new SocialHub, @staff member!
First, please read https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/welcome-to-socialhub/7. Please reply here so we can discuss changes...
Before we can open the forum, there are a few things to be done:
- [\*] Fix the @system user with an avatar, description, etc. - [\*] Create the categories that we need to continue from SocialHub.network and what we discussed so far: - [\*] #fediversity (@fediversity.team, give to @tao) - [\*] #meeting - [\*] #meeting:socialcg - [\*] #meeting:fosdem2020 - [] #meeting:fediconf (@capmisson contacted) - [] #meeting:apconf (post-mortem?) - [\*] #packaging - [\*] #software - [] See also https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/creating-a-template-for-software-implementation-categories/39 - [] #software:foo as they come... (@software-name, @person-in-charge) - [\*] #software:discourse ([@discourse](/g/discourse), ?) - [\*] #software:funkwhale ([@funkwhale](/g/funkwhale), @agate) - [\*] #software:go-fed ([@go-fed](/g/go-fed), @_cj) - [\*] #software:mastodon ([@mastodon](/g/mastodon), @nightpool) - [\*] #software:mobilizon ([@mobilizon](/g/mobilizon), @tcit) - [] #software:write.as ([@write.as](/g/write.as), @thebaer), - [\*] Fix and populate required groups If you see @system in https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/about, probably we need some volunteers ;) Some group descriptions should be updated and made more attractive. - https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/g?filter=hosts - https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/g?filter=team - Populate @staff: - who wants `root`? @how, @nightpool - who wants admin? @how, @nightpool - who wants moderator? @maloki - [\*] activitypub.hosts - [\*] software.hosts - [\*] meeting.hosts - [\*] fediversity.hosts - [\*] contact @nightpool, @how - [] well-being.team - [\*] Change ownership on all #about posts from this initial list to @system so that it does feel welcoming and collective - [] Bootstrap topics to get the conversation started - [\*] About FOSDEM https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/devroom-proposal/25 - [\*] About OCaps (@cwebber can you start a topic in #activitypub?) - [] About the SIG and the relation to SocialCG (Policy, in #community:socialhub-policy?) - [\*] Datashards / DHT / Hashtags (in #activitypub?) - [\*] Restore settings to - [\*] default invitee trust level to 1 - [\*] remove invite only to open public registration - [\*] remove logged-in required to open to the world
_This is a wiki_

@nightpool you’re now admin and owner of the contact group.

nightpool:

category description mentions a “ActivityPub SIG”, and I’ve never heard of that

At APConf, in the community session, we discussed the relation between this forum, the SocialCG, and the W3C in general. People familiar with the W3C processes suggested that the correct term to use when referring to a group that is part of a larger Community Group would be called a Special Interest Group. The attention was to not hijack the SocialCG, while still provide a dedicated space for ActivtyPub-relevant conversation.

nightpool:

SocialCG group

This is not a group, but the #meeting:socialcg category, dedicated to announcing the SocialCG meetings.

item.title: Things to be done before announcing the forum
item.dc:creator: how
item.description:
I guess people who come here will be one of:

  • existing ActivityPub developers
  • interested developers
  • prospecting sysadmins
  • interested Fediverse users and community managers
  • investors/funders, Press, random people

I would imagine an “id card” that would include:

  • what the software is about
  • language and license info
  • a bit of branding
  • team info
  • where is:
    • the source code
    • documentation
    • communication channels including security reports and announcement feeds
    • community norms

Others might want to keep an announcement topic – actually, I’m waiting for the moment when you can federate your announcement feed here

item.title: Things to be done before announcing the forum
item.dc:creator: nightpool
item.description:
As a piece of general feedback: this seems like a lot of to-do items. I think getting feedback earlier is better, and the social cg community feels like it would be better served by a less-fully-polished forum now rather then a more polished forum later. Also this just seems like a lot of structure and I think it just makes more sense to build some of these things out (groups, teams, etc) once there’s a need for them.

Thoughts?

I’m also happy to volunteer for moderator or admin positions as necessary to help shepherd things, chris and gargron and others can vouch for me, or any of the users on the mastodon servers I co-admin: https://cybre.space https://glitch.social
